a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Power Dissipation Index (PDI) of North Atlantic cyclones
The Power Dissipation Index (PDI) measures the activity of cyclones by accounting for cyclone strength, duration,
and frequency. The lines have been smoothed using a five-year weighted average, plotted at the middle year.
Data source: HURDAT (Hurricane Database) of the National Oceanic & Atmospheric Administration (NOAA)
